text: The Canon ELPH 10, released in November 1996, was the lowest-priced camera model in the original ELPH lineup. ==Features== It was a compact fixed-focus point and shoot camera using the Advanced Photo System, sold in Europe as the IXUS FF25 and in Japan as the IXY 10. ==Lenses== The ELPH 10 featured a 25mm f/6.7 lens, built-in electronic flash, and simple programmed automatic exposure with two shutter speeds. ==Cost== ==Related links== ==External links== Category:Canon ELPH cameras Category:Point-and-shoot cameras Category:APS film cameras
title: Canon ELPH 10
